questions.question: Who is the head of the Union Executive in India?
questions.answer: President

questions.question: The real executive power in India is exercised by the ____.

options.text: Prime Minister and Council of Ministers

questions.answer: Prime Minister and Council of Ministers

questions.question: Who appoints the Prime Minister of India?
questions.answer: President

questions.question: The Council of Ministers is collectively responsible to which House?
questions.answer: Lok Sabha

questions.question: Who is the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha?
questions.answer: Vice-President

questions.question: What is the tenure of the President of India?
questions.answer: 5 years

questions.question: Who administers oath of office to the President?
questions.answer: Chief Justice of India

questions.question: Which body advises the President in administration?
questions.answer: Council of Ministers

questions.question: Who can remove the President from office?
questions.answer: Parliament by impeachment

questions.question: Which article deals with the Union Executive?
questions.answer: Article 52

questions.answer: President

questions.question: The Council of Ministers is collectively responsible to which House?
questions.answer: Lok Sabha

questions.question: What is meant by Union Executive?
questions.answer: The Union Executive consists of the President, Vice-President, Prime Minister and Council of Ministers.

questions.question: Who is the President of India?
questions.answer: The President is the constitutional head of the Indian Union.

questions.question: Why is the Prime Minister called the real executive?
questions.answer: Because actual administrative powers are exercised by the Prime Minister and Council of Ministers.

questions.question: What is collective responsibility?
questions.answer: The Council of Ministers is jointly responsible to the Lok Sabha.

questions.question: How is the President removed from office?
questions.answer: The President can be removed by impeachment by Parliament.

questions.answer: The Union Executive consists of the President, Vice-President, Prime Minister and Council of Ministers.
